content: There's a great new meetup at https://www.meetup.com/boston-web-dev-class/ that I checked out this week. Highly recommended!

Philip, thank you!
Edited: sorry I'm still learning zulip. Please delete this message if I don't figure out how to move it to the thread.
I went to this again after work today. @Dave Hanft since you expressed interest I told @Maria Dolgareva your story. I hope you can make it sometime!
@Dave Hanft (and others) if you're around tomorrow and like board games, please see this: #boston > 2025-07 meetup @ ðŸ’¬ :smile:

Philip Durbin said:

Dave Hanft (and others) if you're around tomorrow and like board games, please see this: #boston > 2025-07 meetup @ ðŸ’¬ :smile:

Iâ€™m out of town. Will make it to one of these soon though!

I went to this on Wednesday and had a good time. Usually, I just stay for a little while on my way home but this time I stayed until the end.

@Maria Dolgareva nicely introduces me as someone who runs an open source meetup.

This sometimes leads to someone asking what sort of projects we're working on and I'm glad that this time I was able to point to the "better porchfest" app @Dan created: #boston > Hack Meetup: Building a Better Porchfest Map :tada:
